card_good_to_know_title: Good to know about the card
card_good_to_know_limit_desc:
As a security measure, we've set up limits on how much can be spent and transferred to the card.

Maximum daily spend  %1$d
Maximum deposit per day  %2$d
Maximum deposits per day  %3$d
card_good_to_know_blocks_title: Good to know about blocked stores and ATMs
card_good_to_know_blocks_desc: The card can't be used at ATMs, that would mean you the grown-up wouldn't have control. We have also blocked purchases in some categories of stores for your safety. List of blocked categories of stores:
card_good_to_know_savings_title: Good to know about the savings account and the cloud
card_good_to_know_savings_desc: When you get a card, the cloud will disappear etc.
card_good_to_know_prepaid_title: Good to know about prepaid cards
card_good_to_know_prepaid_desc: Prepaid cards are very good for children since they can't be overdrawn. The card is not connected to a specific account; our card solution provider keeps track of the amount of money and to whom it belongs. The money is actually safer than a normal bank account: neither we nor the bank have access to the money.
card_good_to_know_use_where_title: Good to know about where the card can be used
card_good_to_know_use_where_desc: The card can be used abroad, online and in stores. The card can't be used at ATMs.
migrate_flow_start_description: We have updated Gimi to suit you even better. We just need you to update some settings.
migrate_flow_end_description: That was it. If you're paying in full you won't notice any difference. All settings will be kept.

why_verify_identity: Why do we have to verify your identity?
why_verify_identity_desc:
According to EU legislation and regulations, financial services need to identify their customers, it's called Know Your Customer. 

This means we need to verify your identity. 

We use Instantor, whose solution is based on a BankID login.

app_question_title_for_parent_1: How do I create a chore?
app_question_answer_for_parent_1:
1. Go to the tab ‚ÄúChildren‚Äù. 
2. Select the child to whom you wish to assign the chore. 
3. Select ‚ÄúChores‚Äù. 
4. Select ‚ÄúAdd chore‚Äù. 
5. Create your own chore or choose from popular. 
6. Fill in the information and press ‚ÄúOK‚Äù.
app_question_answer_for_parent_2:
1. Click on the pink plus sign in the lower right corner. 
2. Select ‚ÄúDeposit to cloud‚Äù 
3. Select amount and child. 
4. Press ‚ÄúOK‚Äù to finish.
app_question_title_for_parent_3: How do I make a withdrawal?
app_question_answer_for_parent_3:
1. Click on the pink plus sign in the lower right corner. 
2. Select ‚ÄúWithdrawal from cloud‚Äù 
3. Select amount and child. 
4. Press ‚ÄúOK‚Äù to finish.
app_question_title_for_parent_4: How do I invite my child to the app?
app_question_answer_for_parent_4:
1. Go to the ‚ÄúSettings‚Äù tab. 
2. Select ‚ÄúMy contacts‚Äù. 
3. Select ‚ÄúInvite child‚Äù. 
4. Select ‚ÄúScan QR-code‚Äù or ‚ÄúSend message‚Äù.
app_question_title_for_parent_5: What is pocket money, chores and interest all about?
app_question_answer_for_parent_5:
Think of it as money to learn from. It's about creating a lifelong joyful and healthy relationship with money! 
 
1. Pocket money: A starting amount that is always paid out. It gives the child the possibility to learn the connection between save and spend. 
2. Chores: Problems that children get paid to solve. When creating a healthy relationship with money, it's not all about saving and spending, but earning as well. The earned amount is paid out in addition to the pocket money. 
3. Interest is one of the most important financial phenomena and an important lesson for adult life! Interest payouts are made every week or month, since it's shown that children have a hard time relating to a longer period.
app_question_title_for_parent_7: When should I start giving weekly or monthly pocket money?
app_question_answer_for_parent_7: It‚Äôs common to introduce weekly pocket money when the child is around 5 years old, switching to monthly pocket money when the child is around 11 years old. At this point, the child will practice managing money over the same period of time as most adults do.
app_question_title_for_parent_8: What are your best tips when it comes to chores?
app_question_answer_for_parent_8:
1. Start by giving out recurring chores: regularity gives structure. 
2. Increase the difficulty of the chores as the children get older. 
3. Only pay for chores that children wouldn't otherwise have to do. Setting a price tag on a chore gives the signal that it's okay to turn away the money and so the chore. 
4. Encourage children to suggest their own chores, encouraging their sense of entrepreneurship!
app_question_title_for_parent_9: How does interest in the app work?
app_question_answer_for_parent_9:
Interest is one of the world's most important financial phenomena, but also one of the hardest to understand. Introducing the concept early in a controlled environment is a great way to learn. Our best recommendations:  
1. The interest rate should be high enough to generate interest at reasonable savings capital. 
2. The interest rate should be low enough not to generate too much interest in relation to the weekly or monthly money. 
3. The interest payment is made every Payday. Regularity makes learning easier.
app_question_title_for_parent_10: What can I do to help my child save money?
app_question_answer_for_parent_10:
We have stone age brains that prefer to act on impulse instead of thinking in the long term. Therefore, we must try to save. Some tips:  
1. Set up a dream, something specific to save towards. It helps us to resist impulses. 
2. Provide the opportunity to earn extra money by doing chores. 
3. Pay interest on the money saved. 
4. Match the amount that the child is able to save, and make a deposit to the cloud.
app_question_title_for_parent_11: How do I help my child to spend smart?
app_question_answer_for_parent_11:
1. Let the kids decide how they spend their money so they can learn from their own experiences. 
2. Make a withdrawal from the cloud for each purchase, then it's easier to keep track of their expenses. 
3. Help the kids to research before their purchase by reading reviews and comparing prices. 
4. Introduce them to second hand: better for the wallet and the environment!
app_question_title_for_kid_1: How do I invite my parents to the app?
app_question_answer_for_kid_1:
1. Go to the ‚ÄúSettings‚Äù tab. 
2. Select ‚ÄúMy contacts‚Äù. 
3. Select ‚ÄúInvite grown-up‚Äù. 
4. Select ‚ÄúScan QR-code‚Äù or ‚ÄúSend message‚Äù.
app_question_title_for_kid_2: How do I suggest a chore?
app_question_answer_for_kid_2:
1. Go to the ‚ÄúEarn‚Äù tab. 
2. Select ‚Äúnew chore‚Äù at the bottom of the page. 
3. Create your own chore, or select from popular. 
4. Fill in the details and press ‚ÄúOK‚Äù. 
5. Wait for approval to preform the chore.
app_question_title_for_kid_3: How do I create an account?
app_question_answer_for_kid_3:
1. Download the app. 
2. Select ‚ÄúJoin‚Äù. 
3. Follow the instructions.
app_question_title_for_kid_4: I can‚Äôt log in, what do I do?
app_question_answer_for_kid_4: If you can‚Äôt log in, it can be due to many different reasons. Maybe you entered the wrong email address or telephone number? If you have problems logging in, you can always contact us via the chat in-app or on the website (open weekdays, 9am to 5pm) or send us an email at hello@gimitheapp.com
app_question_title_for_kid_6: I want more money! What can I do?
app_question_answer_for_kid_6:
Earn money by solving problems that someone else is willing to pay for. Here are some examples:  
1. Do more chores: Solve problems for your contacts in the app! 
2. Start your own business: Is there anyone else other than your in-app contacts that have a problem that can be solved? Ask your parents for help! 
3. Get a job: Just like others have problems that need to be solved, companies do as well. (Keep in mind, you need to be a teenager to do this) 
4. Sell your old stuff: There's surely someone else who needs it. 
5. Negotiate: Can you get paid more for problems you are already solving?
app_question_answer_for_kid_7:
Interest is a bonus you get for saving money. 
1. The more money you have in the Cloud, the more interest you'll get on Payday! 
2. The higher the interest rate (in %), the more interest you'll get on Payday (it's your grown-ups who decide the interest rate)
app_question_title_for_kid_8: What can I do to reach my dream quicker?
app_question_answer_for_kid_8:
Recipe on how to reach your dream: 
1. Earn more money 
2. Spend less money 
3. A combination of 1 and 2.
app_question_title_for_kid_9: How do I spend like a pro?
app_question_answer_for_kid_9:
Having money can make us feel like we have superpowers. If we don't use it right, it can be used up way too fast. Here are some tips on how to spend smart: 
1. Ask yourself, is the thing you want to buy that important to you? If not, save your money for something else! 
2. Read reviews. If many people are unhappy with a product, it's a good idea to think twice. 
3. Compare prices and find the cheapest, but keep in mind that if it's too good to be true it often is. 
4. Buy second hand. It's often cheaper and always better for the environment. 
5. Don't spend money you don't have: save instead of borrow!
card_question_title_for_parent_1: How much does the Gimi Card cost?
card_question_title_for_parent_2: What‚Äôs the difference between a normal bank card and the Gimi Card?
card_question_answer_for_parent_2: With the Gimi Card you can set up spending limit notifications, have automated pocket money payout, easily block and unblock the card in the app, see spending statistics and the card can be ordered in the app. Read more about the Gimi Card on our website, gimitheapp.com
card_question_title_for_parent_3: What do I do if my child‚Äôs Gimi Card gets lost or stolen?
card_question_answer_for_parent_3: If the card has been lost or stolen block the card in the app. If it can‚Äôt be found, a new card can be ordered as a replacement. This can all be done in ‚ÄúCard settings‚Äù.
card_question_title_for_parent_4: How can I limit my child‚Äôs spending?
card_question_answer_for_parent_4:
Some categories of merchants are blocked, and the card cannot be used in those stores as a safety measure. Stores in these categories are blocked:  
- Toll and bridge fees 
- Automated fuel dispensers 
- Drinking places (alcoholic beverages, bars and taverns 
- Package stores, beer, wine and liquor 
- Tobacco stores and stands 
- Dating and escort services 
- Internet gambling 
- Government-licensed horse or dog racing 
- Betting (including lottery tickets, casino gaming chips and off-track) 
 
Other than that, you can set up spending notifications to know when your child has overspent, and you can block the card in the app.
card_question_title_for_parent_5: How do you replace the Gimi Card?
card_question_answer_for_parent_5: This is done under card settings in the app.
card_question_title_for_parent_6: How old should you be to get a Gimi Card?
card_question_answer_for_parent_6: We don‚Äôt have a strict age limit for the card, we think that is something all parents should decide themselves. But we recommend all children complete our Card Test.
card_question_title_for_parent_7: How do I know if my child is ready for a card?
card_question_title_for_parent_8: Why should my child get the Gimi Card?
card_question_title_for_parent_9: Where can the Gimi Card be used?
card_question_answer_for_parent_9: The Gimi Card can be used abroad, online and in stores. Some stores and online stores are blocked as a safety measure. The Gimi Card can not be used at an ATM.
card_question_title_for_kid_1: I have forgotten my PIN number, what do I do?
card_question_title_for_kid_2: How much does the Gimi Card cost?
card_question_title_for_kid_3: What‚Äôs the difference between a normal bank card and the Gimi Card?
card_question_answer_for_kid_3: With the Gimi Card you can shop online, login and check your balance yourself, request money and see spending statistics. Read more about the Gimi Card on our website, gimitheapp.com
card_question_title_for_kid_4: What should I do if my Gimi Card is lost or stolen?
card_question_answer_for_kid_4: Tell your parents immediately and ask them to block your card. If you think you lost it, look for it. If you find it, your parents can just unblock the card again. If the card can‚Äôt be found or if it has been stolen, keep it blocked and ask your parents to order a new one.
card_question_title_for_kid_5: How do I replace the Gimi Card?
card_question_answer_for_kid_5: You need your parents' help to do this, so ask them.:)
card_question_title_for_kid_6: I want the Gimi Card, what do I do?
card_question_answer_for_kid_6: Children can‚Äôt order a card from us, only parents can. Sorry about that!
card_question_answer_for_kid_8: A PIN code is like a password to your card. When you buy something in a store you need to insert your card and enter your PIN code in order for the card to work.
card_question_title_for_kid_9: What do I do if I type the wrong PIN code too many times?
card_question_answer_for_kid_9: If you type the wrong code three times the card will be blocked. That means you can‚Äôt use the card anymore. The card can be unblocked by your parents, so talk to them if the card has been blocked.
card_question_title_for_kid_10: My card isn‚Äôt working, what has happened?
card_question_answer_for_kid_10:
When paying for something with your card, it could happen that it says the purchase was not approved. This means that for some reason the transaction was not successful and the stuff you were going to buy was not paid for. There could be a few reasons for this:  
You don‚Äôt have enough money on your card. Double check that you have enough money on your card by logging in to the Gimi app. 
You entered the wrong PIN code 
The card details that you entered were wrong. Look at your card again and double check them. The card number is super long, maybe you typed in a wrong digit somewhere? 
You are trying to purchase something from one of the stores that we have blocked 
Your parents haven‚Äôt approved your card for online purchases. Talk to them about it.
card_question_title_for_kid_11: Where can the Gimi Card be used?
card_question_answer_for_kid_11: The Gimi Card can be used abroad, online and in stores. Some stores and online stores are blocked as a safety measure. The Gimi Card can not be used at an ATM.
gimi_question_answer_for_parent_1: We make money from our Premium users who choose to pay our subscription cost. We always strive to be transparent with our pricing and never to abuse or sell any customer data or private information to any third party user.
gimi_question_title_for_parent_2: What is Gimi‚Äôs vision and goals?
gimi_question_answer_for_parent_2:
We believe in young people and want to give them financial superskills - for life. By this we mean that we want to give the power to young people to make great financial decisions by learning about money management. We will not rest until we have made money concepts and other complicated subjects concrete, real and meaningful for everybody. 
Joyful - We make earning, saving and spending money both easy and fun. 
Clever - We make money and other complicated subjects concrete, real and meaningful.  
Empowering  young people to make great financial decisions throughout their life by learning about money concepts, and money management.
gimi_question_answer_for_parent_3: We started Gimi since there is a lack of understanding when it comes to money and because society needs a new way to educate young people about money.
gimi_question_answer_for_parent_4: Our ethical guidelines show how we work with children and teenagers, and how we adapt our marketing and services so that they're understandable for everyone. Our ethical rules can be read on our website gimitheapp.com
gimi_question_title_for_parent_5: How do I get in contact with Gimi?
gimi_question_answer_for_parent_5: You can contact us through our chat (open weekdays, 9am - 5pm), either on our website or in the app. You can always drop us an email to hello@gimitheapp.com
gimi_question_answer_for_kid_1: We make money from our Premium users who choose to pay our subscription cost. We always strive to be transparent with our pricing and never to abuse or sell any customer data or private information to any third party user.

gimi_question_title_for_kid_5: How do I get in contact with Gimi?

register_question_title_for_parent_1: How do I order the Gimi Card?
register_question_answer_for_parent_1: The Gimi Card can be ordered on our website or in the app.
register_question_title_for_parent_2: How do I connect my child to the app?
register_question_answer_for_parent_2:
1. Go to the ‚ÄúProfile‚Äù tab. 
2. Select ‚ÄúMy contacts‚Äù. 
3. Select ‚ÄúInvite child‚Äù. 
4. Select ‚ÄúScan QR-code‚Äù or ‚ÄúSend message‚Äù.
register_question_title_for_parent_4: The Gimi Card has arrived, what to do now?
register_question_answer_for_parent_4:
First of all, congratulations on the card, we hope that it will serve your family well for a long time. Now, give your kid the best possible start to spending their money  
1. Take out the card from the package. 
2. Go into the app an activate the Card. 
3. Go through the card details (everything on the card) and how to use it. 
4. Look at the app, tell your child about the different functionalities. What does balance mean? What is a transaction? 
5. Go through the test questions. What to do with the PIN code? 
6. Deposit money on the card, then go and make their first purchase together!
register_question_title_for_parent_5: How do I create an account?
register_question_answer_for_parent_5:
1. Download the app. 
2. Select ‚ÄúJoin‚Äù. 
3. Follow the instructions.
register_question_title_for_parent_6: How do I set up pocket money and interest?
register_question_answer_for_parent_6:
If you just became contacts: 
1. Go to the tab 'Children'.
2. Select 'Add money' 

If you want to edit:
1. Go to the tab 'Settings'
2. Select 'Settings for [name of the child]'
3. Choose 'Amount' and 'Interest' to edit them.
register_question_title_for_parent_7: How do I create a chore?
register_question_answer_for_parent_7:
1. Go to the tab ‚ÄúChildren‚Äù. 
2. Select the child to whom you wish to assign the chore. 
3. Select ‚ÄúChores‚Äù. 
4. Select ‚ÄúAdd chore‚Äù. 
5. Create your own chore or choose from popular. 
6. Fill in the information and press ‚ÄúOK‚Äù.
register_question_answer_for_parent_8: The Cloud is a savings account that shows all parents and other grown-ups debt to the child. The money in the Cloud should be paid out by the grown-up. The money is used by paying for the child in store or giving cash followed by a withdrawal from the Cloud.
register_question_answer_for_parent_9: Everything that the child earns during a week or month, depending on if the child has weekly or monthly pocket money, is collected in Payday. The amount in Payday goes to the Cloud on Payday. Payday consists of pocket money, interest and rewards for chores.
register_question_title_for_kid_1: I want the Gimi Card, what do I do?
register_question_answer_for_kid_1: As a child you can‚Äôt order a card from us, your parents need to do that. Sorry!
register_question_title_for_kid_2: I have got my Gimi Card, now what do I do?
register_question_answer_for_kid_2:
First of all, congratulations on receiving your Gimi Card. We hope it will serve you and your family well. 
1. Take out the card from the package. 
2. Go into the app and activate the Card. 
. Go through all the card details with your parents. 
4. Look at the app to check the functionalities. Can you see the Card balance? How much money is there in the savings account? 
5. Go through the test questions again. What to do with the PIN code? 
6. Now you are ready to make your first purchase. If you want to, ask your parents or an older sibling to go with you the first time.
register_question_title_for_kid_3: How do I connect my parents to the app?
register_question_answer_for_kid_3:
1. Go to the ‚ÄúProfile‚Äù tab. 
2. Select ‚ÄúMy contacts‚Äù. 
3. Select ‚ÄúInvite grown-up‚Äù. 
4. Select ‚ÄúScan QR-code‚Äù or ‚ÄúSend message‚Äù.
register_question_title_for_kid_5: How do I create an account?
register_question_answer_for_kid_5:
1. Download the app. 
2. Select ‚ÄúJoin‚Äù. 
3. Follow the instructions.
register_question_title_for_kid_6: How do I suggest a chore?
register_question_answer_for_kid_6:
1. Go to the ‚ÄúEarn‚Äù tab. 
2. Select ‚Äúnew chore‚Äù at the bottom of the page. 
3. Create your own chore, or select from popular. 
4. Fill in the details and press ‚ÄúOK‚Äù. 
5. Wait for approval to preform the chore.
register_question_answer_for_kid_7: The Cloud is a savings account that shows all parents and other grown-ups debt to the you. The money in the Cloud should be paid out by the grown-up. You use the money in the Cloud by getting cash form a grown up or by a grown-up making a purchase for you. The grown-up then makes a withdrawal from the Cloud.
register_question_answer_for_kid_8: Everything that you earn during a month or week, depending on if you have weekly or monthly pocket money, is collected in Payday. The amount in Payday goes to the Cloud on Payday. Payday consists of pocket money, interest and rewards for chores you have completed during the week or month.
rights_and_security_question_title_for_p: What personal information is required when ordering or registering the Gimi Card?
rights_and_security_question_answer_for_: To verify the parents‚Äô identity we use BankID which requires a personal identity number. Other than that, we require your address, so that we can send you the Card, and the child‚Äôs name, so it can be printed on the Card.
rights_and_security_question_title_for_p: How do you handle personal information and data that I create?
rights_and_security_question_answer_for_: Compliant with GDPR, The Swedish Data Protection Authority and PCI DSS.
rights_and_security_question_title_for_p: How strong is Gimi‚Äôs data security?
rights_and_security_question_answer_for_:
Gimi‚Äôs data security is strong. We encrypt all data using SSL/HTTPS. And for your own safety, we verify your identity before you can start managing money. In bank language, this is called Know Your Customer: all in accordance with international banking regulations. For users ordering the Card, we use BankID (parents) and Instantor to comply with all regulations around verifying users' identity. 
 
Users managing real money in the app can feel safe, your data is protected with a two factor authentication method. Also, the Gimi Card is not connected to a specific account, our card maker, PFS, keeps track of the transfers and to whom they belong. The money is actually safer than a usual bank account: neither we nor the bank has access to the money. 
 
We handle all personal information and data that you create in compliance with GDPR, The Swedish Data Protection Authority and PCI DSS.
rights_and_security_question_title_for_p: How do I block my child‚Äôs Gimi Card if it‚Äôs lost or stolen?
rights_and_security_question_answer_for_: Go into Card settings to block it. The card can easily be unblocked again if it‚Äôs found.
rights_and_security_question_title_for_k: What personal information is required when ordering or registering the Gimi Card?
rights_and_security_question_answer_for_: To verify the parents‚Äô identity we use BankID which requires a personal identity number. Other than that, we require your address, so that we can send you the Card, and the child‚Äôs name, so it can be printed on the Card.
rights_and_security_question_title_for_k: How do you handle personal information and data that I create?
rights_and_security_question_answer_for_: Compliant with GDPR, The Swedish Data Protection Authority and PCI DSS.
rights_and_security_question_title_for_k: How strong is Gimi‚Äôs data security?
rights_and_security_question_answer_for_:
Gimi‚Äôs data security is strong. We encrypt all data using SSL/HTTPS. And for your own safety, we verify your identity before you can start managing money. In bank language, this is called Know Your Customer: all in accordance with international banking regulations. For users ordering the Card, we use BankID (parents) and Instantor to comply with all regulations around verifying users' identity. 
 
Users managing real money in the app can feel safe, your data is protected with a two factor authentication method. Also, the Gimi Card is not connected to a specific account, our card maker, PFS, keeps track of the transfers and to whom they belong. The money is actually safer than a usual bank account: neither we nor the bank has access to the money. 
 
We handle all personal information and data that you create in compliance with GDPR, The Swedish Data Protection Authority and PCI DSS.
rights_and_security_question_title_for_k: How do I block my Gimi Card if it‚Äôs lost or stolen?
rights_and_security_question_answer_for_: The Gimi Card needs to be blocked by your parent. Ask them to do it for you. It can be done in their settings. It can be unblocked if the card should be found again.

welcome_to_gimi_desc_2: Let your money grow and earn extra on interest. Save your money in the Cloud to reach your dream.
welcome_to_gimi_desc_3: Get paid for completed chores and learn how to earn your own money.

kid_allowance_month_error: Not available. %1$d already has weekly pocket money from somebody else.
word_from_ceo_header: Welcome to the new Gimi app!
word_from_ceo_desc: This is our biggest update that we have been working on for over a year. I hope you and your family will love it!
empty_graph_state: Give it some time, and this will turn into a nice graph!
custom_notification_onboarding_old_user_: Get to know your new app
Get to know your new app
set_interest_descr: which is calculated on how much is saved
future_interest_help_desc: The figure you see here shows how much bonus you receive for saving money. The more money you have in the Cloud, the more interest you get as a bonus
future_allowance_help_desc: The figure you see here shows how much you have in weekly or monthly pocket money. You receive the money either once a week or once a month
chore_transaction_help_desc: The number you see here shows how much you earned on the chores you completed during the week or month.
reboarding_desc: You will continue where you left off. If you want to start over, go to your settings and delete your account.
future_allowance_help_desc_parent: The figure you see here shows the weekly or monthly pocket money amount, which is paid out unconditionally
chore_transaction_help_desc_parent: The figure you see here shows how much a child has earned from chores during the week or month.
future_interest_help_desc_parent: The figure you see here shows an estimate of the next interest payment, which is based on the savings amount in the Cloud.
monthly_allowance_amount_explainer: Pocket money is paid out unconditionally. We recommend an amount that is the average of what other children of the same age get.
weekly_allowance_amount_explainer: Pocket money is paid out unconditionally. We recommend an amount that is the average of what other children of the same age get.
interest_explainer: Understanding interest is a valuable lesson for adulthood and encourages children to start saving. We recommend an amount that is the average of what other children of the same age get.
allowance_frequency_explainer: Weekly or monthly? It depends on the time period over which a child is mature to manage money. It‚Äôs common that children younger than 11 years get weekly pocket money, and that children older than 11 years get monthly pocket money.
accepted_invite_chores_explainer: Chores give children the opportunity to earn some extra. It‚Äôs important for children to learn how earning money works, not just receiving it unconditionally. These are the most popular chores amongst children of the same age.

delete_connection_warning_for_parent: The money that you owe %1$d will dissappear from the cloud. Are you sure you want to delete %1$d?

card_lost_stolen_confirmation_title: Your new card is on it‚Äôs way!
card_lost_stolen_confirmation_text: Don‚Äôt worry. Your old card has been disabled so your money is safe. You will need to activate your new card when it arrives before you can use it.

why_we_ask_for_phone: Why do we need your number?
explainer_why_phone_title: Do we really need your phone number?
explainer_why_phone_desc: We use your phone number to connect you to your family, and to make sure no one else gets access. You'll also use it to log in to your Gimi account!
payday_takeover_text_parent: %1$d has been added to the cloud
accept_email_contact: Yes, you can contact me over e-mail
premium_intro_main_desc_for_kid: Get ready to handle real money!
premium_intro_savings_desc_for_kid: Your Cloud has been upgraded into a real savings account, and some new stuff in the app‚Ä¶
premium_intro_card_desc_for_kid: Start spending anywhere you want, but spend responsibly. Your card is on. it‚Äôs way!
more_than_allowance: PLZ_CHECK More than just pocket money
more_than_allowance_desc: PLZ_CHECK Give weekly or monthly pocket money, pay extra for chores and set your own interest rate on the savings.
you_are_the_bank_desc: PLZ_CHECK The children save in the app and you payout the money when they want to buy something. To make a deposit or withdraw, press the round plus button!
gather_your_family_desc: PLZ_CHECK Invite children and discover a more fun and educational way to handle money together.
how_does_tasks_work_desc: PLZ_CHECK The children kan get chores to preform for a payment, to learn how to make money. You or the child can suggest chores!
invitation_reminder_title: Want to send an invitation reminder?
invitation_reminder_text: The person you tried to connect haven't yet accepted your invitation to connect. Let's send a reminder!
permission_asked_success_text: Your request has been sent. We‚Äôll let you know how it goes!
asking_for_deposit_permission_title: %1$d wants permission to send money to %2$d
asking_for_deposit_permission_subtitle_s: %1$d will now be able to send money to %2$d.
accepted_to_deposit_text: %1$d has approved that you can send money to %2$d. Now you need to register your card!
cloud_in_n_days: added to the cloud in %1$d days
